trans-unit.source: Debug a background task
trans-unit.target: Debug a background task

trans-unit.source: Learn how to debug a background task, including background task activation and debug tracing in the Windows event log.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to debug a background task, including background task activation and debug tracing in the Windows event log.

trans-unit.source: Debug a background task
trans-unit.target: Debug a background task

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.Background
trans-unit.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.Background

trans-unit.source: Learn how to debug a background task, including background task activation and debug tracing in the Windows event log.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to debug a background task, including background task activation and debug tracing in the Windows event log.

trans-unit.source: This topic assumes that you already have an existing app with a background task to debug.
trans-unit.target: This topic assumes that you already have an existing app with a background task to debug.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the background task project is set up correctly
trans-unit.target: Make sure the background task project is set up correctly

trans-unit.source: In C# and C++, make sure the main project references the background task project.
trans-unit.target: In C# and C++, make sure the main project references the background task project.

trans-unit.source: If this reference is not in place, the background task won't be included in the app package.
trans-unit.target: If this reference is not in place, the background task won't be included in the app package.

trans-unit.source: In C# and C++, make sure the **Output type** of the background task project is "Windows Runtime Component".
trans-unit.target: In C# and C++, make sure the **Output type** of the background task project is "Windows Runtime Component".

trans-unit.source: The background class and must be declared in the entry point attribute in the package manifest.
trans-unit.target: The background class and must be declared in the entry point attribute in the package manifest.

trans-unit.source: Trigger background tasks manually to debug background task code
trans-unit.target: Trigger background tasks manually to debug background task code

trans-unit.source: Background tasks can be triggered manually through Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks can be triggered manually through Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Then you can step through the code and debug it.
trans-unit.target: Then you can step through the code and debug it.

trans-unit.source: In C#, put a breakpoint in the Run method of the background class, and/or write debugging output by using [**System.Diagnostics**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh441592.aspx).
trans-unit.target: In C#, put a breakpoint in the Run method of the background class, and/or write debugging output by using [**System.Diagnostics**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh441592.aspx).

trans-unit.source: In C++, put a breakpoint in the Run function of the background class, and/or write debugging output by using [**OutputDebugString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa363362).
trans-unit.target: In C++, put a breakpoint in the Run function of the background class, and/or write debugging output by using [**OutputDebugString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa363362).

trans-unit.source: Run your application in the debugger and then trigger the background task using the suspend drop down menu in the **Lifecycle Events** toolbar.
trans-unit.target: Run your application in the debugger and then trigger the background task using the suspend drop down menu in the **Lifecycle Events** toolbar.

trans-unit.source: This drop down shows the names of the background tasks that can be activated by Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This drop down shows the names of the background tasks that can be activated by Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For this to work, the background task must already be registered and it must still be waiting for the trigger.
trans-unit.target: For this to work, the background task must already be registered and it must still be waiting for the trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a background task was registered with a one-shot TimeTrigger and that trigger has already fired, launching the task through Visual Studio will have no effect.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a background task was registered with a one-shot TimeTrigger and that trigger has already fired, launching the task through Visual Studio will have no effect.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Background tasks using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) or [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543), and background tasks using a [**SystemTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224838) with the [**SmsReceived**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224839) trigger type, cannot be activated in this manner.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Background tasks using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) or [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543), and background tasks using a [**SystemTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224838) with the [**SmsReceived**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224839) trigger type, cannot be activated in this manner.

trans-unit.source: debugging background tasks
trans-unit.target: debugging background tasks

trans-unit.source: When the background task activates, the debugger will attach to it and display debug output in VS.
trans-unit.target: When the background task activates, the debugger will attach to it and display debug output in VS.

trans-unit.source: Debug background task activation
trans-unit.target: Debug background task activation

trans-unit.source: Background task activation depends on three things matching up correctly.
trans-unit.target: Background task activation depends on three things matching up correctly.

trans-unit.source: This procedure shows how to check and make sure that these all match up.
trans-unit.target: This procedure shows how to check and make sure that these all match up.

trans-unit.source: The name and namespace of the background task class
trans-unit.target: The name and namespace of the background task class

trans-unit.source: The entry point attribute specified in the package manifest
trans-unit.target: The entry point attribute specified in the package manifest

trans-unit.source: The entry point specified by your app when registering the background task
trans-unit.target: The entry point specified by your app when registering the background task

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio to note the entry point of the background task:
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio to note the entry point of the background task:

trans-unit.source: In C# and C++, note the name and namespace of the background task class specified in the background task project.
trans-unit.target: In C# and C++, note the name and namespace of the background task class specified in the background task project.

trans-unit.source: Use the manifest designer to check that the background task is correctly declared in the package manifest:
trans-unit.target: Use the manifest designer to check that the background task is correctly declared in the package manifest:

trans-unit.source: In C# and C++, the entry point attribute must match the background task namespace followed by the class name.
trans-unit.target: In C# and C++, the entry point attribute must match the background task namespace followed by the class name.

trans-unit.source: For example: RuntimeComponent1.MyBackgroundTask.
trans-unit.target: For example: RuntimeComponent1.MyBackgroundTask.

trans-unit.source: All the trigger type(s) used with the task must also be specified.
trans-unit.target: All the trigger type(s) used with the task must also be specified.

trans-unit.source: The executable MUST NOT be specified unless you are using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) or [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543).
trans-unit.target: The executable MUST NOT be specified unless you are using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) or [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543).

trans-unit.source: Windows only.
trans-unit.target: Windows only.

trans-unit.source: To see the entry point used by Windows to activate the background task, enable debug tracing and use the Windows event log.
trans-unit.target: To see the entry point used by Windows to activate the background task, enable debug tracing and use the Windows event log.

trans-unit.source: If you follow this procedure and the event log shows the wrong entry point or trigger for the background task, your app is not registering the background task correctly.
trans-unit.target: If you follow this procedure and the event log shows the wrong entry point or trigger for the background task, your app is not registering the background task correctly.

trans-unit.source: For help with this task see [Register a background task](register-a-background-task.md).
trans-unit.target: For help with this task see [Register a background task](register-a-background-task.md).

trans-unit.source: Open event viewer by going to the Start screen and searching for eventvwr.exe.
trans-unit.target: Open event viewer by going to the Start screen and searching for eventvwr.exe.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Application and Services Logs** -> **Microsoft** -> **Windows** -> **BackgroundTaskInfrastructure** in the event viewer.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Application and Services Logs** -> **Microsoft** -> **Windows** -> **BackgroundTaskInfrastructure** in the event viewer.

trans-unit.source: In the actions pane, select **View** -> **Show Analytic and Debug Logs** to enable the diagnostic logging.
trans-unit.target: In the actions pane, select **View** -> **Show Analytic and Debug Logs** to enable the diagnostic logging.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Diagnostic log** and click **Enable Log**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Diagnostic log** and click **Enable Log**.

trans-unit.source: Now try using your app to register and activate the background task again.
trans-unit.target: Now try using your app to register and activate the background task again.

trans-unit.source: View the diagnostic logs for detailed error information.
trans-unit.target: View the diagnostic logs for detailed error information.

trans-unit.source: This will include the entry point registered for the background task.
trans-unit.target: This will include the entry point registered for the background task.

trans-unit.source: event viewer for background tasks debug information
trans-unit.target: event viewer for background tasks debug information

trans-unit.source: Background tasks and Visual Studio package deployment
trans-unit.target: Background tasks and Visual Studio package deployment

trans-unit.source: If an app that uses background tasks is deployed using Visual Studio, and the version (major and/or minor) specified in Manifest Designer is then updated, subsequently re-deploying the app with Visual Studio may cause the app’s background tasks to stall.
trans-unit.target: If an app that uses background tasks is deployed using Visual Studio, and the version (major and/or minor) specified in Manifest Designer is then updated, subsequently re-deploying the app with Visual Studio may cause the app’s background tasks to stall.

trans-unit.source: This can be remedied as follows:
trans-unit.target: This can be remedied as follows:

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell to deploy the updated app (instead of Visual Studio) by running the script generated alongside the package.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell to deploy the updated app (instead of Visual Studio) by running the script generated alongside the package.

trans-unit.source: If you already deployed the app using Visual Studio and its background tasks are now stalled, reboot or log off/log in to get the app’s background tasks working again.
trans-unit.target: If you already deployed the app using Visual Studio and its background tasks are now stalled, reboot or log off/log in to get the app’s background tasks working again.

trans-unit.source: You can select the "Always re-install my package" debugging option to avoid this in C# projects.
trans-unit.target: You can select the "Always re-install my package" debugging option to avoid this in C# projects.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the app is ready for final deployment to increment the package version (don’t change it while debugging).
trans-unit.target: Wait until the app is ready for final deployment to increment the package version (don’t change it while debugging).

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Make sure your app checks for existing background task registrations before registering the background task again.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your app checks for existing background task registrations before registering the background task again.

trans-unit.source: Multiple registrations of the same background task can cause unexpected results by running the background task more than once each time it is triggered.
trans-unit.target: Multiple registrations of the same background task can cause unexpected results by running the background task more than once each time it is triggered.

trans-unit.source: On Windows, if the background task requires lock screen access make sure to put the app on the lock screen before trying to debug the background task.
trans-unit.target: On Windows, if the background task requires lock screen access make sure to put the app on the lock screen before trying to debug the background task.

trans-unit.source: For info on specifying manifest options for lock screen-capable apps, see [Declare background tasks in the application manifest](declare-background-tasks-in-the-application-manifest.md).
trans-unit.target: For info on specifying manifest options for lock screen-capable apps, see [Declare background tasks in the application manifest](declare-background-tasks-in-the-application-manifest.md).

trans-unit.source: Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.
trans-unit.target: Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.

trans-unit.source: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.
trans-unit.target: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.

trans-unit.source: For more info on using VS to debug a background task see [How to trigger suspend, resume, and background events in Windows Store apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh974425.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more info on using VS to debug a background task see [How to trigger suspend, resume, and background events in Windows Store apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh974425.aspx).
